alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 1:22AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Chester Creek Near Chester affecting Delaware County. For the Chester Creek...including Chester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chester Creek near Chester. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The creek floods adjacent open land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:16 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:16 AM EST Thursday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 03/29/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Chester Creek Chester 8.0 8.0 Thu 1 am 2.9 MSG 8.3 2am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 700 AM EST.
